name: Kepler-343
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-343 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-343 is a star with 1.8499999999999992 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.43 times its radius. It is located 3106.11 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-343 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-343 b

Kepler-343 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.09 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 8.97 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-343.

The mass of Kepler-343 b is 7.94 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-343 b is 2.41 that of Earth. At 7.94 Earth masses, Kepler-343 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-343 c

Kepler-343 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.17 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 23.22 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-343.

The mass of Kepler-343 c is 5.19 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-343 c is 2.02 that of Earth. At 5.19 Earth masses, Kepler-343 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-343, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
